page.title: 05 KENLEY
page.content: From the churchyard in Kenley one can see the Welsh mountains and from the lower tower of the 13th Century Church part of Watling Street can be seen in the valley to the north. The church of St.John the Baptist has 500 year old beams in the roof and a canopied pulpit made by Jacobean craftsmen. Similar to this is a chair in the chancel and carving in the priest's desk. The organ is two manual and retains a hand pumping mechanism. The present Post Office was formerly a school and house and is now the only Post Office within the area. There are no shopping facilities, people in the village shopping either at Shrewsbury or Much Wenlock. There is one farm in the village called Church Farm and another opposite the church which has 400 sheep and 50 cattle.
